text.section: There is a Commission police force.

section.section: A Commission police officer may exercise the powers of a law enforcement officer in the State on property that is owned, leased, or operated by or under the control of the Commission.

After consulting with the Secretary of State Police and the Police Training Commission, the Commission shall adopt regulations to carry out this section, including standards for character, training, education, human relations, experience, and job performance for Commission police officers.
To the extent practicable, the Commission shall adopt standards that are similar to the standards of the Department of State Police.

Standards adopted on or after October 1, 2002, on minimum hiring qualifications of Commission police officers do not affect the status of an individual who was a qualified Commission special police officer on October 1, 2002.
